content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
──────────────────────
### Shared Smelting Furnaces Automation Network at positions (0.0, 0.0), (5.0, 0.0), (2.5, 0.5) & (2.5, -0.5)
Consists of:
• Stone Furnace for Iron Smelting at (0.0, 0.0) paired with a Burner Inserter at (1.5, 0.5) and a Dedicated Output Chest at (0.5, 2.5)
• Stone Furnace for Copper Smelting at (5.0, 0.0) with a Burner Inserter at (3.5, 0.5)
• Common Input Chest – Wooden Chest at (2.5, 0.5)
• New Feeder Inserter – Feeder Inserter at (2.5, -0.5) with pickup at (2.5, -1.5) and drop at (2.5, 0.5)
• Transport Belt Connection linking the mining output to the feeder inserter

### Iron Ore Mining Automation Setup at (-15.0, -50.0)
Consists of:
• Burner Mining Drill at (-15.0, -50.0) with output drop at (-14.5, -48.5)
• Drill Inserter at (-13.5, -47.5)
• Sink Chest – Wooden Chest at (-11.5, -46.5)
• Sink Inserter – Burner Inserter at (-10.5, -46.5) with pickup at (-9.5, -46.5) and drop at (-11.5, -46.5)
• Transport Belt Connection linking the mining drill drop to the sink inserter pickup

### Automation Research Lab at (5.5, 5.5) with Updated Electrical Connection
Consists of:
• Lab at (5.5, 5.5) (status: NO_POWER; research on Automation in progress)
• Electricity Network comprising a mix of original and newly placed Small Electric Poles forming ElectricityGroup (now id=1281) aimed at connecting the Lab to power sources

### Water Supply System for Power Generation with Updated Steam Engine Placement
Consists of:
• Boiler at (8.0, 20.5) (status: NO_FUEL; fuel insertion recently processed with output issues)
• Offshore Pump at (0.5, 30.5) (status: WORKING)
• Steam Engines:
 – Steam Engine at (8.5, 17.5) (status: NOT_CONNECTED; warnings: “not connected to power network”, “no input liquid”, “no fluid present in connections”)
 – Steam Engine at (11.5, 20.5) (status: NOT_CONNECTED; similar warnings)
• An intended pipe connection from the Boiler to the Steam Engines remains unsuccessful
• A newly crafted Steam Engine is now available in inventory for subsequent placement

ERROR TIPS
────────────────
• Pipe Connection and Alignment:
 – Verify that pipe endpoints are accurately aligned and unobstructed. Clear nearby entities to eliminate collisions that prevent successful pipe connections.

• Inventory Verification for Entity Placement:
 – Confirm that the required item exists in inventory prior to placement. An attempt to place an entity (such as a steam engine) without inventory availability will lead to placement failure.

• Crafting Sub-Ingredient Management:
 – Ensure all necessary intermediate components (for example, sufficient iron-plates to produce iron-gear-wheels) are available before initiating a craft. If shortfalls occur, extract outputs from furnaces to bolster component inventories.

• Furnace Operation and Fuel Insertion:
 – Before inserting fuel (or an alternative fuel) into a furnace, clear its output inventory to avoid insertion errors due to full capacity. Monitor both fuel levels and furnace output status to maintain smooth smelting operations.

• Consistent API Usage:
 – Utilize standardized, lowercase prototype names and correctly access entity position attributes when repositioning or placing entities. This helps avoid reference errors or type mismatches during API calls.
